result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Clerk Cheree
Cases 15CF1076, 15CF1039 and 15CF1064 called: 4:17pm
State appears by ADA C.Minder.  Def appears in person/in custody and with Atty Jack Bliss.  

>>>>>Parties note JT to be set in case 15CF1039 -- NO AGREEMENT REACHED IN THIS CASE.<<<<<

Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed in 15CF1076 and 15CF1064.  VRCW
State moves to:
15CF1064 - Ct. 1 (Felony BJ/Repeater)>>AMEND to DELETE Repeater allegation.
15CF1076 - Ct. 1 (Battery to Peace Officer/Repeater)>>AMEND to DELETE Repeater allgation.
15CF1076 - Cts. 2, 3, and 4>>All D&RI
COURT GRANTS ABOVE

PLEA:
15CF1064 - Ct. 1 (Felony BJ)>>GUILTY
15CF1076 - Ct. 1 (Battery to Peace Officer)>>GUILTY

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.
Defendant makes statement.

COURT ORDERS: 
6 years TOTAL on each count: 3 years Incarceration and 3 years ES, on each count, concurrent, w/credit for 255 days of time already served on each count.
CONDITIONS: Absolute sobriety; Any assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by PO; CC; DNA sample and surcharge.
>>Defendant does NOT qualify for either CIP or SAP.

COURT directs parties to schedule 15CF1039 for Jury Trial.

records.addlTxt: Shall not consume alcohol.  No contact with victim(s): C.F.N. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.
